title: Should I use 'century' or 'centuries' in the sentence 'between 4th and 6th (century)'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The sentence as you have written it there references two Centuries together, so it is correct to say: Between the 4th and 6th Centuries… If you reference them separately, then you would use the singular, for example: Between the 4th Century and the 6th… Or: From the 4th Century to the 6th… (Note also that it is the standard convention to give Century a capital City when referring to a specific time period.

When I’m unsure, I try using different nouns. Then the answer becomes clear. “I’m traveling between [state / states].” It’s obviously states.“We are at different [point / points] in our lives.” It’s clearly points.Try this tip and you won’t get stumped again!
